Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus begin the words of Albucasim.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	O, sons, thus I have completed this book, which is the last of the science of medicine, for through its completion and the end it has brought to itself, and through its explanations and declarations, it is evident to me that I have filled you with this treatise, which is part of my surgical operations.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	For our region and in our time, surgical operation is almost entirely private, despite the great importance of its science. Its investigation has been neglected; and only some minor descriptions can be found in the books of the Ancients, which correct many errors and hesitations, but close off the understanding of it and extend its force and art.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And it is clear to me that I should vitalize that part of this treatise according to the way of explanation and declaration and abbreviation; and in order that the forms of the cautery tools and other instruments of the work be added through the declaration, and for their preparation, which cause is necessary.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	More so, the reason why a good artisan doctor does not use his hand well in this our time is that the art of medicine is long and involved, and one must be trained before being able to practice anatomy, which Galen knew well, understanding the youth of the members and their forms, as well as their joints and separations; and having knowledge of the bones, nerves, and tendons, their number, and their diseases; and of the pulse veins and quiet ones, and the places of their propulsion.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And for this, Hippocrates is said to have said that by name is good, more in the small work, and most of all in the art of the hand.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	More so, we have already spoken of this in the introduction to this work; for those who do not know what we have said about anatomy, will not be free from error due to which many people will die, as I have seen too many of them. For some are formed in this science and act without that other knowledge and experience.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	For I have seen a foolish and inexperienced doctor who caused an apostema scrophula in the neck of a woman, and damaged some arteries so that great bleeding occurred, causing the woman to die among her greatest sufferings.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And there was another doctor who almost extracted a stone from a man who had been suffering for some time, and the stone was large, and it came to him, and he removed that stone with a piece of the bladder, so that that man died on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And I have already called for the stone to be extracted, and I saw that due to the size of the stone and the position of the patient, he would likely die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And there was another doctor who took payment from a duke of our land for surgery, and he came upon a black slave who had a fracture in the thigh; and because of the doctor's ignorance, he removed the fracture, over the wound, with pillows and splints of strong structure, and did not allow the wound to breathe.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And then the dislocation according to his desires, and then the rejoining, and then the leaving for a few days and commanding us to release the bandage; and we remained thus until the thigh and foot recovered, and then proceeded to our detriment.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And I was called to him, and prepared to dislodge the stone, and peace and an attempt to relieve his pains were achieved.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	But however, corruption was confirmed in the member, for I could not arrest that, and did not cease to walk the corruption in the member while the malady persisted.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And there was another doctor who perforated an oncological abscess, and it became ulcerated over several days, during which the malignancy of the lesion grew significantly in the presence of its lord.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	The cause is that the pain is purely due to melancholic humors, and does not affect the entire body, but rather affects a member that suffers from being attacked by all.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And for this reason, my children, it is necessary that you devise the operation into two divisions: one in which the operation is associated with health, and another in which the work is dangerous in its major dispositions.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And I have already existed in all parts of this book in which the operation is accompanied by error and fear; therefore, it is necessary that you keep this and leave that, so that the leaves do not find a way to speak and deceive you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And therefore take your arms with diligence and protection of God, and the patient with facility and firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the best way by the grace of God seeking salvation and praiseworthy success, and leave behind the terrible illnesses difficult to cure, and stand firm in your arms against what fears you, so that sitting in your faith and in your name you are not forsaken: for more remains to your glory, and better elsewhere and later in the world and beyond in your sanctity.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Gout has already been dissected in some monastic texts:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	Do not treat ill diseases, lest bad doctors go unnamed.
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And I have already dedicated this book according to three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	Begin the division of the book, and first of the first part.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter ordered of the foot, on the forms of the instruments and on the tools of the cautery, and on what is necessary in the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter, on dryness and perforation, and on cups, and on sores, and on the extraction of arrows and similar, all categorized and ordered by the forms of the instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	The division of the third part.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter, on restoration and dislocation, and on the cure of扭伤和类似病症；按仪器形状分类的章节。头部涉及脚部，以及仪器的形式。
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	On the cautery with fire and with sharp medicine, and a reminder of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	With that, he begins the treatise of the whole book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	I will describe the quality of the irons of that cautery and its effects, and in which complications cauterization is prohibited.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore, I say that the discourse on the quality of the cautery iron and its effects is long and prolix, subtle by science, and secretly hidden; much has already been said about it by wise men, and they are in disagreement. It suffices me to give a small part of their sermons, fearing lengthiness.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And thus it is said that a cautery applied to any complexion universally works on all matters or bodily substances, except for two complexes, which are complexes of solid matter.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the complex of solid and dry matter, dehydration occurs; for some said that a cautery is beneficial for this, while others said the opposite, that a cautery is not appropriate in illness which is due to quality and dryness, for the nature of fire is quality and dryness, and it is inappropriate that an illness that is solid and dry be healed by what is cautery and dry.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And argue against those who say the opposite, that by cautery one is cured in all solid and dry illnesses that come in the bodies of men, for when you compare the body to its humors to the complex of fire, you find the body is parched.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say according to the speech of those who have experienced this, that they have already discovered it several times through experimentation.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	But I do not claim that it comes to me as one who has already been experienced and exercised in the capital of cautery by recent exercise, and who knows the diversity of human complexions and the disposition of illnesses in their manifestations, and the causes of those, and the accidents related to them, and the space of time for those.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	In other complications, there is no need for you to fear, and especially in the wet and inflammatory diseases, for all doctors are agreed on those, and do not differ in using a cautery in them.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And I say, children, that concerning the secret of curing by cautery with fire and its goodness, about the burning medical cautery, it is because the fire is simple, and its action reaches only the member being cauterized and causes no great harm to other members in contact.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	But the action of the burning medical cautery reaches that part in the member which it touches, and greatly causes illness in the member that is diseased and difficult to heal.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	But fire, by its sublimity and the goodness of its substance, does nothing but superfluous things. And we are already known for this through experience and long service to the study of the art concerning the true causes; and for this reason, I am excused for the length of my discourse. If it were not that it is not written in my liberty in this pause, and that you know a secret about the fire, and the quality of its operation on the bodies and the way by which you expel diseases, then this discourse would be philosophical and demonstrative, which would be acute for your minds.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And be wise, children, that they do not agree on the time at which it is convenient to make a cautery and pause in late spring.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And I say that a cautery is convenient at all times, because the damage caused by the accident of time is submerged in the youth of what is burned by the cautery, and especially if the cautery is for pains or necessary pains, strong boils, which do not suffer delay because it is feared that those that come from evil intent are greater than small damage entering through time.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And this is not good in your feet, children, for they only consider the common people and the foolish doctors, because in that illness which is cured by a cautery it is not convenient all the time, and they pause that consequence.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the cause is not thus because they care for this, for a cautery is not other than in a place of medicine which alters the composition and dries the humors which are the cause of the venous pains.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	Yet, however, an excessive cautery over the medicine for the sake of its efficacy and virtue of its operation and greatness of its lord.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	It is possible that the patient's illness may return at some point in time, according to the complexity of the illness, its location, the virtue of the individual, and what is prepared within the body through the accumulation of superfluous substances, or what is acquired by the body in terms of foods and similar causes; but if the illness in which a cautery is administered is a subtle illness in a member with few superfluous substances and humidity, like a dental cautery for pain and similar to that, it is possible that such pain will not return, more so as this is done in small amounts.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	The vulgar saying is that the cautery is the last remedy of medicine, and it is a saying of doctors, not what we understand by it, for I believe it is not a cure that helps either medicine or any other cause close to the cautery.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	The cause is the opposite; and I understand that the cautery is the last remedy of medicine only when one has administered the methods of cure for some illnesses, and those medicines have not been effective, and near the end of the illness, one administers the cautery, which then helps.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And at this point, the last remedy of medicine is the cautery, not according to the understanding which I understand the vulgar and most of the foolish doctors.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And the ancients said that a gold cautery is better than an iron one, and they did not say this only because of the equality of gold and the sublimity of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they said that the place for cautery does not burn, since it is not absolutely perfect; for I have already proved and examined that it does not do this in all bodies as others do. A gold cautery is good and better than iron, as they say; but when you make a cautery with fire of gold, it is not up to you to declare, because it ignites according to the quantity you want due to the hardness of the gold, and prepares to receive fire; if you adjust over the ignition, the gold melts by the fire, and some sheets are cast into the fire for the craftsman to catch from that.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And for this, when making a cautery with iron, you should touch it more lightly and more precisely to the correct position.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And I have already ordered this chapter on the cautery according to chapters, and I have ordered those of the foot in the leg, so that I delay the patient what he wants from me.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	Of the cautery for head pain due to cold and humidity.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cautery addresses the cold and humidity over the servel accident of which there are two causes, these being the cause of rheumatism and various pains in the head, from the forehead to the ears flowing, as well as many sleep disorders, toothache, and giddiness, and generally all illnesses that come through coldness, such as paralytic conditions, rheumatism, and apoplexy, and similar symptoms in those diseases.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The form of this cautery is as follows: Primarily, you command the patient to be evacuated with a saline medicine for three or four nights, according to the strength of the patient's condition, their age, and their habits.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then command him to shave his head with a razor, and place that razor between your hands on a sloping bench and let his hands rest on his own foot.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And place the razor from your palm near the throat between his heels.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	More over, since the right place has been determined, mark that place with a point, and then heat the olive oil cautery, which is in this form:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And place that cautery over the marked spot with a point, in such a way that it descends gradually, and you rotate it.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And lift your hand lightly and look at the spot, and if you see any part of the bone being uncovered by a small amount of oil, as much as a grain of pepper, then lift your hand. If not, return your hand to that cautery or another, if it is cooled, and wait until something is visible on the bone as I have said to you.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And take a little salt and dissolve it over the spot, and leave it there for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	Then place your hand over the inflamed groin area, leaving the other one on the inside where the fire scar has been destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	Then apply the ointment of tetra pharmacon to the area until it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And we have already said that when the wound is opened wide, it heals better, because it is better and more beneficial.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	And some of them say that the knee should be cauterized inside the bone, and that the cautery should be left until it has ignited some part of the bone.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	Then scrape away what is charred from the bone, and then treat it.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	And others say that the cautery should reach the marrow, pressing firmly on the bone until it cools, and this is the method of Alphécatti.
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	And they believe that from that area, the vapors of the head expire.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And keep the wound open for a long time, and then treat it until it is healed and consolidated.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	But I have not seen these two types of cautery in all, except in some men according to fear; leave that one, I advise you, it is better for health when possible; as the head is developed by the solution of continuity of the same kind as we have testified in other members, especially when the head of the patient is of cold nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And the first type of cautery is safer and better, I advise you; use that one and do so for health.

Del cauteri del cap.	Of the cautery of the head.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc. Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	May cautery in medicine that burns you take a hot coal, and extract that and bind the extremities of it from both ends.

Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When you treat that person as we have said in the division and your treatment is not effective, then you prepare and give to drink to the patient cherries for three nights; then shave his head, and cauterize the area with a cautery made of iron and another of olive wood.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	Then cauterize that area with a cautery made of iron on both supraorbital regions, leaving the hair slightly singed.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And be careful not to burn that area.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	And this is the form of the cautery made of iron.
Capitol .xv.	Capitol. XV.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	Of the cautery for the eyelids of the heels.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the heel is softened due to disease or humidity, then cauterize that eyelid with a cautery made from this lunar cautery; and this is its form:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you cauterize that area on both supraorbital regions a little with two cauteries in total, making them long from the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And the length of each cautery should be according to the size of the sore.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press too hard with your hand on the cautery, but according to the extent that the inner part of the eyelid is touched.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter XVI.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	Of the cautery for the eyelid when the skin is converted to the inner parts and fistula occurs.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the skin of the fistula is converted to the inner parts, one must puncture the fistula. The cautery for this can be performed in two ways: either by using a cautery or by applying burning medicine.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If the cautery is to be made with fire, command the patient to present himself before you that the skin may be cauterized as those which are cleansed, when they are prolonged and equalized; and if you puncture it, you should place it at its origin. Then strengthen the fistulas of the patient with a bandage so that they do not rupture until the skin is grown back.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Then when they are born and equalized, place the head of the patient on your knee, and hold over the eyelids of the patient with a sign, which should be in the shape of a leaf of hawthorn, and is the beginning of the mark for the skin.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	Then place the head in a pillow of cloth or on a mucilaginous substance over the eye.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	Then ignite the cautery of which this is the shape.
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	Then apply the cautery over the shape marked, little by little in small spots, until the surface of the wound is burned, which appears like a hawthorn leaf, entirely apparent and proper.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	A sign of healing from your work is that you see the eyelid of the eye now contracted and the skin around it elevated after the puncture of the eye.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	Then lift your hand and leave it there for three days, and then place it over the head between the eyebrows until the scar is healed.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And after apply the ointment where it shall be healed.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	And if it returns through the skin for some cause near their origin and the eyelid is softened, then apply the cautery again over that area as you did first.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	And if the skin is on the eyelid, then apply the cautery there, lifting it to its natural place and ensuring that the skin does not remain loose.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	And the cautery being medicinally burning, you command the patient to extend and equalize the skin, then make a cloth letter in the shape of a mulberry leaf.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. i, o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And then take a well-known and effective ointment and some vinegar. Mix these well, and prepare this mixture without rubbing it; then spread it over the cloth which is made in the shape of a mulberry leaf, and place that over one or both wounds; and leave the cloth slightly loose, with the patient's head at the top.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	And place it on the medicine and press it a little but do not wet it inside so that the patient feels the bite of the medicine, for the bite is like that of fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	And so, to perceive the bite of the cauterization, when you leave the medicine and wet that as you have said; then when the bite ceases, place the medicine again and wash it well with water; and then consider if the eyelid has already been raised, as it is washed, close it again with fire or incision, for then it is good; and if not, return to the place of the medicine where you did not press the medicine, and do not deface your operation until it is equalized.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	And then place it on the swelling between the time that the bond of adherence is eradicated, and then treat it with a thick ointment or another method until it is healed.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	And you must, with diligent vigilance, ensure that the medicine does not fall from your operation onto the whole. If the eyelid becomes softened in a few days or any of the skin blisters on the whole, then repeat your medicine over that area where the eyelid has softened, and do so precisely as you did at the beginning, and continue to apply it until it is healed.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	And this is the form of leaf of mistletoe.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	And know that the humors of men are diverse according to their size and smallness, and therefore according to this you should make your contraction.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And the way of the straight path should not be hidden from him who studies in this art.
Capitol .xvii.	Capitol. xvii.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	On the cautery treatment of a fistula that is in the lacrimal humor.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you treat a fistula as we have said in the divisions of the maladies and do not refer to our treatment, then when you cauterize it according to this manner: command the patient to place his head in your lap, and have some minister hold his head with both hands in such a way that it is neither too tight nor agitated on his head.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	And then place a cloth soaked in oil or in a mucus of ptilli on the eye.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then heat the cautery of which this is the form:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	which is convex, as the form of a cane or a vuelto pin, from one end of which the cautery is made.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if it goes, penetrate into the other end.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you want it to come out as it tries.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	But nevertheless, that which is concave is better for your work.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	And then press the fistula if it is open, and cleanse and dry that area.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not open, then open that and extract the pus from it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	And then place the well-heated cautery on it, and with your hand hold the cautery at the end of the nose, so that your hand does not err or the patient be disoriented, and then place the cautery in the nostrils and destroy that.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And if at the beginning of your cautery it enters into the bone, that is good; but otherwise, then iterate the cautery one or two times, if necessary; and leave it thus for three days, and afterwards place your hand over the spot to keep it warm and apply an ointment while it heals.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	And if it does not heal after ten days, then place your hand over the corrosive sharp medicine until the bone is exposed and cut as needed according to your chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	And another way to cauterize a fistula that some first say: Apply the cautery at the site of the fistula and immediately place your hand gently over the fissure, forming its shape. Pour one ounce of melted lead into this fissure; keep your hand there with good retention, so that the bad humor does not enter and prevent the melted lead from reaching the spot. Then leave your hand over the opening of the bad humor as if in a thick paste of honey or water, for the lead adheres to the site of the fistula and heals it through marvelous healing.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed as we have said regarding the cautery and the cure, that is good; and if not, then it is necessary to administer atracone of the nose and reduce the fistula to the nose's body according to its proper place.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter XVIII.
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	On the cautery of the fissure of the pus.
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Spotting occurs and causes fissures in the labia, especially in the labia of children.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	Then, since you cure those fissures as we have said in the divisions and do not prolong your cure, then heat the small surgical cautery according to this form that is shown:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	And let its cavity be according to the subtlety of the blade.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Then place that heated cautery over the fissures until it reaches the bottom of the fissures.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	And then cure it with cerate until it is healed.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter XIX.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	Of the cautery treatment for fistula in the mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When an abscess forms in the uvula or on the palate or around the teeth, and after it bursts and heals, leaving behind a fistula that does not fully heal, you should then cauterize with a firebrand according to the size of the fistula. Place the ignited brand inside the fistula, keeping your hand close so that the flame reaches the entire length of the fistula. Do this one or two times. Then treat the area as we have described for other healing processes until it is fully healed.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And if the abscess is incised and heals, that is good. Otherwise, it is necessary to expose the location and excise the corrupt bone as described in its chapter.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter XX.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	Of the cautery treatment for the teeth and the softening of the gums.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the arteries are softened by humidity and the teeth are rotten, and you cure those with medicines without applying them, then place the patient's head in a basin of cold water, and soon light the cautery in the form which will be shown to you shortly, try that you place the quinula over the tooth and insert there the burning cautery forcefully, and have it remain just long enough for the patient's teeth to feel the heat from the fire.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	Lift your hand, and repeatedly apply the cautery several times according to your desire.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	And then make the patient spit out salt water and hold it for an hour, after which apply a salve, as the rotten tooth is closed, the softened gum is tightened, and the corrupted humidity is dried.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter XXI.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	On the Cauterization of Tooth Pain.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When tooth pain is due to cold or rot or you cannot cure it with medicine, then the cauterization in that area can be done according to two methods: either with a cow's horn cautery, or with fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	With the pointed cautery, you should take horn from cows and bulbs therefrom in the place of iron, then take some and wrap it around the tip of the needle, then immerse that with the horn bulb, and place it over the tooth in pain urgently before it is rubbed.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And then repeatedly apply that several times until the virtue of the fire penetrates to the root of the teeth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if wool or some cloth is immersed in the horn above mentioned, place it over the aching tooth, and hold the ignited iron over it until the iron penetrates to the root of the tooth.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	However, the cautery with fire should be applied when there is a wart or iron, and if any large part of it is in its core, do not allow the heat of the fire to reach the root of the tooth.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	And then apply the cautery in the shape it will take, and place it over the tooth while holding your hand there until the cautery is rubbed. Do this several times so that the pain may be intensified or on that day or the next.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And ensure that when the cautery reaches the affected area, it fully opens its mouth to good measure and keep it there for about an hour; this is the form of the cautery.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And cauterize where you feel the extremity according to what is possible.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	And this is the form of the cannula:
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter XXII.
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	On the cauterization of extrophy.
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When extrophies are of phlegm and humors that are not responsive to digestion by medicines, and you have lightly digested them, then heat the cautery to the form which follows: having two open ends so that smoke can escape from one end, place the cautery over the abscess for one minute, and another if needed until it reaches the root of the abscess.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit. E la forma de la cannula o deu cauteri a tal es comveyter.	And the shape of the needle or cautery is as conveyed.

De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	On the cautery treatment for hoarseness and the constriction of throat.
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut.	When humidities enter the channel of the lung, and especially when this is due to a complex coldness, then it is necessary that the patient be treated with medicines that act as laxatives at the beginning. Capitol .xxv.	Chapter 25.
De cauterizacio de titillic que es le cap del ajutori.	Of the cautery for titillium which is the head of the helper.
Quan le cap del ajutori es dislocat per causa de humiditatz lubricas e no es fermat en la hora del sieu retornament deves la sua dislocacio entro que sia a lu aquo costuma de retornar, e aprop per un petit movement es deslocat ayssi que s’endeve, ayssi cum nos havem testificat, lahoras cove que primieyrament redusiscas la dislocacio, e aprop le malaute sia reversat sobre le sieu dos o sobre le latz sa; e aprop eleva la codena la qual es en la partida dedintz del citillic a las partidas desus am les ditz de la tua ma sinistra, si la junctura es dislocada a las partidas dedintz.	When the head of the helper is dislocated due to lubricous humidity and is not fixed in the hour of its return, you must reduce its dislocation within the time it customarily returns, and then by a small movement it is displaced thus as one seeks, thus as we have testified. Then first reduce the dislocation, and place the malformed part on its back or on the side; and lift the codena which is in the inner partition of the citillus to the upper partitions above your left hand, if the joint is dislocated in the inner partitions.
E aprop igneys le cauteri havent dos caps; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And then heat the cautery having two heads; this is its form:
E aprop cauteriza la codena entro que penetre aquela entro al autre latz; e vindra la figura de cauterizacio lahoras de iv caps cauteris.	And then cauterize the codena before it penetrates into the other side; and the figure of the cautery will come when using two heads.

E alcunas veguadas es ajustat segon aquest comte i per que son les cauteris .viii.	And sometimes the cautery is adjusted according to this count and because the cauteries are .8.

De cauterizacio del stomac.	On the cauterization of the stomach.
Quan veno en l’estomac freg e motas humiditatz entro que aquel extrazo de la sua compleccio e so multiplicatz raumases a lu, e si tu continuas las manieyras de curacio e no confereyso, lahoras cove que le malaute sia sobre le sieu dos ressupinat, e extenda las suas mas e las suas coysas, e aprop cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris: an un cauteri dejos le pietz per la quantitat d’un dit am cauteri clavilh, e am dos cauteris dejos del dos costatz del cauteri, entro que vengua la figura de cauteri triangulada; e elonga entre els que no sian ajustatz que faran poyredura.	When cold and humid humors enter the stomach before it is extracted from its composition and multiply there, if you continue the curative methods and do not confirm it, then you should suspect that the gout affects the sole of the foot. It extends its hands and its things, and then cauterize it with three cauteries: on one cautery, place the foot for the width of a finger with a clavicle cautery, and on two cauteries, place the sides of the cautery, so that the figure forms a triangular shape; and keep the gaps between those that are not adjusted to prevent suppuration.
E si la profunditat del cauteri la quantitat de les dos terses de la grocesa de la codena.	And if the depth of the cautery equals the quantity of two thirds of the thickness of the cord.
E sia la figura del cauteri segon aquesta forma ses addicio, E si vols, cauteriza am gran cauteri en le mieg loc del estomac segon aquesta forma; et aquest sia un cauteri segon la forma de cercle segon aquesta forma:	And let the shape of the cautery be as shown in this addition. E sia cauterizat l’estomac punctan ad aquel que de aquest cauteri es spaventat: e es que tu senhes sobre l’estomac punt segon la quantitat que voles am tenta, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en les puntz; e aprop cura aquel am la curacio qu’es precedita entro que sia sanat.	And let the stomach be cautery-punctured where one is afraid from this cautery: and you should prick the stomach with a point according to the quantity you desire to test, then immediately cauterize that with the cautery at the points; then cure that with the cure that precedes until it is healed.

De cauterizacio del fietge fret.	Of the cautery for the heel pain.
Quan endeve en le fietge dolor per fregiditat o per humiditat o per grossa ventositat entro que de la sieua normal compleccio sia getat per egressio superflua, e es curat le malaute am aquo que havem dit e no comfereys, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e senhes am tenta tres cauteris segon aquesta forma et aquesta quantitat meteyssa sobre le fietge dejos dels ipocondres, la hon perve le decubit de home.	When there is pain in the heel due to coldness or humidity or excessive moisture that has exited from its normal structure through excess excretion, and the malady is treated with what we have said and does not improve, then you should ensure that the malady is reinserted into its neck, and prick three cauteries according to this form and quantity placed on the heel below the hypochondria, letting it reach the recumbent position of a person.
E sia l’espazi le qual es entre quascun cauteri segon la grossetut del dit, e sia le cauteri segon la longitut del cors dreyta.	And let the space be which is between each cautery according to the size of the finger, and let the cautery be according to the length of the body straight.
E no compremas la tua am le cauteri mot.	And do not let your hand move while applying the cautery.
E si la quantitat de aquo que es adhurit la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena, e no y sia pus ajustat; e si le malaute stant sobre les pes de lu; e si no es estant, lahoras sia jassent, le qual ja ha extendudas las suas coysas, e eleve les sieus brasses.	And if the amount that is applied equals the size of the width of the codena, and it is not adjusted further; and if the disease is located on the feet; and if not standing, then lying down, which has already extended its parts, and elevates its knees.

E a tu es possible que cauterizes aquestz cauteris am cauteri cutellar, quan es am tu subtilitat e prudencia en l’art.	And when you are capable with your subtlety and prudence in the art, you may apply these cauteries with a surgical cautery.

And be careful not to overheat the cautery, and let the width of the application cover the entire codena so that the heat affects the whole body and penetrates into the intestines, for the codena here is thin; and know this.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter XXVIII.
De perforacio de apostema del fietge am cauteri.	For the perforation of an abscess on the foot, use a cautery.
Quan endeve excitura o apostema en le fietge e voles saber si aquel apostema es en le carn del fietge o en la tunica de lu, lahoras si es en la carn del fietge, le malaute atrobo gravitat e dolor ses acuitat.	When there is inflammation or an abscess on the foot and you want to know if the abscess is in the flesh of the foot or in the skin of the foot, then if it is in the flesh of the foot, the patient will experience a greater degree of swelling and acute pain.
E si es en la tunica del fietge, am la dolor es acuitat gran e vezes que ja afatiguatz les metges la cura de lu.	And if it is in the skin of the foot, then the pain will be acute and often so severe that it exhausts the doctors treating it.
Donc cove que·l malaute sia enversat sobre la sieua cervit; e aprop senha le loc de l’apostema am tenta; e aprop igneys le cauteri le quel es asemblat a rag, la forma del qual a precedit en l’autra pagina.	Therefore, ensure that the patient is lying on their side; and place the location of the abscess under examination; then heat the cautery, which resembles a reed in shape, as described on the previous page.
E cauteriza am aquel i cauteri entro que tota la codena sia comborida, entro que pervengua al ciphac, entro qu’en yesca sania.	And cauterize it, ensuring that the entire cord is burned through, reaching the tendon, until it becomes healthy.
E aprop cura aquel per curacio dels autres apostemas entro que sia sanat.	And treat it with the treatment for other abscesses until it is healed.
E no cove que de aquesta forma de cauteri use sino aquel del qual le estudi en l’art de medicina es prolonguat, e en las mas del qual motas malautias an conogut; mays aquest am esperiment alcunas veguadas sia ardit sobre aquesta operacio, mays empero leyssa aquela deves nos, e es miels.	And one should use only that cautery of which the study in the art of medicine is extended, and in which many ill-fated matters are known; but this man has sometimes experienced several times burning in this operation, yet I leave that to you, and it pleases me.

De cauterizacio de plauresi.	Of the cautery for pleurisy.
Diyssero les antics cauteri de las razitz de aristologia a plauresi frega segon aquesta manieyra esser fazedor, e es aquest que tu prenguas de las razitz de aristologia longa secca una razit pun longua que es trobada, e sia de la grossetut del dit.	They said that the ancient cautery for the ribs in pleurisy should be made according to this manner, and it is what you should take from the ribs of aristologia a long dry stick with a sharp end, which has the thickness of a finger.
E aprop submergeys aquela en oli e eysen aquela al foc, e aprop cauteriza per un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre la continuacio de la furcula am le col; e am dos cauteris petitz dejos guidazi, un pauc declinans a la partida que es dejus la barba, e am dos cauteris en aquo que es declinant entre la quinta costa e la cizena, declinant un pauc a las partidas detras; e am autre cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz; et am autre sobre l’estomac, et am tres cauteris de las partidas detras; et am un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre las dos spallas, e am dos cauteris dels dos latz del pietz, dejos le cauteri le qual es entre doas spallas.	And then immerse it in oil and heat it over the fire. Then cauterize with a cautery in that place which is between the continuation of the furcula and the neck; use two small cauteries slightly inclined towards the part below the chin, one slightly declining towards the fifth rib and the thirteenth, respectively; use another cautery in the middle of the foot; use another on the stomach, and three cauteries behind; use one cautery between the two shoulders, and two cauteries on each side of the foot, placing the cautery between the two shoulders.
E no cove que compremas la tua ma am le cauteri, ans sia en le manifest de la codena en obra.	And do not hold your hand on the cautery, but rather in the middle of the sole working.
E ja diyssero alscus antics que so alscus dels homes les quals uson de cauteri de ferr semblant a ray e igneysso aquel, e meto aquel en aquel loc le qual es entre las costas, entro que pervenguam am aquel ad aquel apostema e sia foragetada sania, ayssi cum havem dit en l’apostema del fietge. Mays en aquesta perforacio am cauteri no es ses temor, quar hu mor tantost ho accideys en le loc fistula a la qual no es sanacio.	Yet in this puncture with the cautery, there is no need for fear; for if it happens in the location of the fistula, which does not heal, it will quickly occur.

De la cauterizacio de la melsa.	Of the cautery treatment for melena.
Quan tu curas la malautia de la melsa am aquo que havem dit de la curacio en la divisio e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cauteri en lu es segon tres manieras, las quals totas son dreyturieras, de las quals la una es que fassas tres cauteris o quatre linhan segon la longitut de la melsa segon la figura dels cauteris del fietge, la figura dels quals ha precedit. E no compremas la tua ma am le cauteri; e le malaute sia eves sobre lo sieu dos.	And do not place your hand on the cautery; let the patient be held over its back.

E aprop entromet les dos vernimentz, ignitz mot, en aquel entro que am aquels penetres la codena de la autra part.	And then place the two vessels close together, ignite the wick, in that space where you insert the chain from the other side.
E aprop extrayt le cauteri; e donc son faytz quatre cauteris.	And then remove the cautery; and thus he makes four cauteries.
E si voys, cauteriza am cauteri havent tres vernimentz.	And if you boil, cauterize with a cautery having three verticils.
E aprop tu cura le cauteri pus que aia laysat de getar brac per trops jorns, quar mays es comferent que las autras causas precedentz en la curacio.	And then cure the cautery well after it has been let to burn for too many days, as this is more comfortable than the other previous causes in the cure.
